comments.text:
mTerminatedMutex might be useless. It protects a boolean whose value only ever progresses in one direction. Futhermore, it appears that whenever the parser gets terminated, the tree op executor stops executing new tree ops right away, so it doesn't matter how soon or late the stream parser stops producing more tree ops.

mTerminatedMutex should be removed if it indeed is useless.
